remarks: A point belongs to the closure of a subset iff there is a sequence in the subset converging to it.  Theorem 1.4-6(a) of [Kreyszig] p. 30. This proof uses countable choice ~ ax-cc .  A space satisfying the conclusion of this theorem is called a sequential space, so the theorem can also be stated as "every first-countable space is a sequential space".  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
